is there a command to free up ram?: no, but you dont need too, memory managment in linux is pretty good. It is a good thing if all your memory is being used, and if you look closely you see a lot of it is used for buffering to speed things up
does program or cache get move to swap first
your swap will only contained unused program code, cache is a buffer, that doesnt get swapped, if more ram is needed buffer space is freed and reallocate for program memory
